medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper
text: Yoshida Chizuko’s prints often merge vivid emotion with abstract imagery, and this work reflects her deep love of music. Inspired by the lively rhythms of mambo, as suggested by the title, the composition captures the syncopated energy of the genre. Set against a hovering gray background, delicate musical notes appear to drift or dance in space. A jagged black line establishes the beat, while purple, blue, and red forms evoke the movement of arms or instruments. Streaks of red, yellow, and brown burst outward like sound flaring into the air. The overall impression is one of freedom, buoyancy, and exuberance. Though Chizuko had not yet traveled abroad when this print was made, her exposure to Cuban music in Japan left a strong impression. The work reflects her belief in the connection between sound, color, and motion—translating rhythm and feeling into a vibrant visual language.
title: Mambo A
